thread.title: DisruptJ20 blocking checkpoints and breaking windows in Washington D.C.
thread.title_full: DisruptJ20 blocking checkpoints and breaking windows in Washington D.C.

author: tips@hotair.com (Hot Air Network, LLC)
title: DisruptJ20 blocking checkpoints and breaking windows in Washington D.C.
text:
The DisruptJ20 people are doing their best to make a mess of Washington D.C., exactly as they said they would. So far there have been blocked checkpoints and broken windows. Police even used teargas on a group of anarchists. Here’s a round-up of what is going on this morning.
First, protesters are shutting down various checkpoints by chaining/locking themselves together across the entrances. The following tweets and video come from DC Examiner reporter Ryan Lovelace:
#BlackLivesMatter and #DisruptJ20 protesters trying to shut down an #Inauguration checkpoint near John Marshall Park pic.twitter.com/erSJAVmVoi 
— Ryan Lovelace (@LovelaceRyanD) January 20, 2017 

Looks like these chained-together #DisruptJ20 protesters are planning to be here awhile. Police not intervening. pic.twitter.com/WdPtDZGXe7 
— Ryan Lovelace (@LovelaceRyanD) January 20, 2017 

There have been some scuffles between protesters and frustrated Trump supporters [some NSFW language here]:
Fistfight breaks out between Bikers for Trump and #DisruptJ20 protesters near barricaded #inauguration checkpoint. pic.twitter.com/IHLI7cyXy6 
— Ryan Lovelace (@LovelaceRyanD) January 20, 2017 

Some people have politely agreed to find another entrance:
#disruptj20 protesters blocking men in Air Force uniforms from getting through the #Inauguration checkpoint pic.twitter.com/XVErOHHBwg 
— Ryan Lovelace (@LovelaceRyanD) January 20, 2017 

And this same pattern is being repeated at various checkpoints:
Protesters attempt blockade of security checkpoint. pic.twitter.com/eH4xmM5hcs 
— Patrick Madden (@Patrick_Madden) January 20, 2017 

Getting tense at 10th and E as police escort Trump supporters through protesters. pic.twitter.com/sEDSma3oXh 
— Patrick Madden (@Patrick_Madden) January 20, 2017 

Police trying to keep peace at 10 and E. But protesters continue to clash with officers as Trump supporters have trouble getting in. pic.twitter.com/p6TqeZxOfU 
— Patrick Madden (@Patrick_Madden) January 20, 2017 

Protesters chanting “This is what a police state looks like!” probably not winning any points with the cops (who have a tough job to do today):
This is what it's like trying to get to the checkpoint at 10th and E for Trump supporters. pic.twitter.com/zs35Uww9w1 
— Patrick Madden (@Patrick_Madden) January 20, 2017 

Elsewhere, a group of black-clad anarchists started running through the streets and smashing windows.
Protesters smash windows of Bank of America, police moving in pic.twitter.com/lJZDQSwagB 
— Zoe Tillman (@ZoeTillman) January 20, 2017 

Smashed windows. pic.twitter.com/yXin6JVMsH 
— Byron Tau (@ByronTau) January 20, 2017 

Anti-Trump protesters smash windows of Starbucks in Washington. #InaugurationDay pic.twitter.com/P6jR8ygY5l 
— AnonNews #SLY (@4n0nc47) January 20, 2017 

Images of some of the damage:
Protesters smash windows, authorities use chemical spray to deal with crowd near Franklin Square https://t.co/ifUZ968mgX pic.twitter.com/xYAlyNEqgz 
— Post Local (@postlocal) January 20, 2017 

Strongly oppose folks coming to D.C. to smash windows. Property destruction doesn't stop trump. #Inauguration pic.twitter.com/zV3327GnM8 
— Melissa Byrne (@mcbyrne) January 20, 2017 

Anti-Trump protesters smash windows of Starbucks in Washington. ( @HuntedHorse ) pic.twitter.com/4hs2HexwEl 
— Breaking911 (@Breaking911) January 20, 2017 

Police are responding with tear gas:
Teargas, cops in riot foot and protesters breaking windows. pic.twitter.com/WiSo92Qo3L 
— Patrick Madden (@Patrick_Madden) January 20, 2017 

A new NSFW chant:
New #DisruptJ20 chant "F**k Donald Trump and Mike Pence too!" #Inauguration pic.twitter.com/dDvSomLkqh 
— Ryan Lovelace (@LovelaceRyanD) January 20, 2017 

#BREAKING Officials: 2 DC police officers taken to hospital from scene of protest
— FOX Baltimore (@FOXBaltimore) January 20, 2017 

The protesters wanted to create chaos and shut down the inauguration. They haven’t succeeded in that but they have made a mess of Washington D.C.
